title: ProLog
tagline: Digital platform empowering apprentices to track progress, competencies, and certification pathways with clarity and confidence
team: Project Manager, Lead Designer, 2 Front-end Developers, Content Strategist

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: ProLog is a digital platform designed for apprentices to track their progress, competencies, and certification pathways throughout their training journey. The platform addresses the challenge of fragmented information and unclear milestones by providing a simple, motivating, and accessible solution that emphasizes visual progress tracking and clear communication. Built with a focus on user clarity and mobile accessibility, ProLog transforms complex certification requirements into an intuitive, step-by-step experience.

images.alt: ProLog platform overview showing dashboard interface

research.title: Research & Insights
research.description: We conducted comprehensive user research to understand apprentice pain points and training coordinator needs. Through user interviews with 15 apprentices across various trades, competitive analysis of existing training platforms, and surveys reaching 50+ users, we identified critical insights. Key findings: Apprentices need visual progress indicators to stay motivated, mobile support is essential for on-site access, and clear, jargon-free language reduces confusion. Training coordinators emphasized the importance of milestone visibility and easy progress sharing with employers.

images.alt: Research findings and user pain points

lofi.title: Lo-Fi Concepts & Early Design
lofi.description: Initial wireframes focused on three core screens: dashboard overview, progress pathway visualization, and competency tracking. Early feedback from apprentices revealed that traditional list-based layouts felt overwhelming and lacked motivation. We iterated toward a more visual approach, introducing a pathway metaphor that shows progress as a journey. Low-fidelity prototypes tested navigation patterns and information hierarchy, leading to decisions about card-based modules and progressive disclosure of detailed competency information.

iterations.title: Iterations & Refinements
iterations.description: Through three major iteration cycles, we refined the platform's usability and visual appeal. Iteration 1: Introduced a Visual Pathway for progress tracking, replacing static checklists with an interactive journey map. Iteration 2: Reduced cognitive load by breaking dense information into modular cards with clear visual hierarchy and breathing room. Iteration 3: Implemented motivational language patterns, replacing technical jargon with encouraging, action-oriented copy that celebrates milestones and guides next steps.
improvements: Visual pathway replaces static checklists for intuitive progress tracking
Modular card design reduces cognitive load and improves scannability
Motivational language encourages engagement and celebrates achievements
Progressive disclosure reveals details only when needed
Mobile-first responsive design ensures on-site accessibility

solution.title: Final Solution
solution.description: The final ProLog platform features a clean editorial layout emphasizing whitespace, strong typography, and visual hierarchy. The hero section establishes clarity and purpose, followed by benefits panels that communicate value propositions. Feature modules showcase core functionality—progress tracking, competency management, and certification pathways—using modular cards and interactive elements. A team credits section acknowledges collaboration, while a prominent CTA encourages exploration. The design system prioritizes accessibility, readability, and motivational design patterns that keep users engaged throughout their apprenticeship journey.

outcomes.title: Impact & Reflection
outcomes.description: ProLog successfully transforms complex certification tracking into an intuitive, motivating experience. User testing showed significantly easier comprehension of progress milestones and reduced confusion about next steps. The modular design system allows for easy expansion to additional trades and certification pathways. Lessons learned: Visual progress indicators dramatically improve motivation and engagement. Editorial layout with generous whitespace enhances readability and reduces cognitive load. Collaborative design process with subject matter experts ensures accuracy while maintaining user-centered simplicity. Mobile-first approach proved essential for apprentices accessing information on-site.
